Acts 2:14, 22-33/Mt 28:8-15 (261) Pss Prop; 8 If necessary, the Chrism Mass may be celebrated on a suitable day before Holy Thursday.; 9 Nine readings are assigned to the Easter Vigil: seven from the Old Testament and two from the New. If circumstances; demand in individual cases, the number of prescribed readings may be reduced. Three selections from the Old Testament,; both from the Law and the Prophets, should be read before the Epistle and Gospel. In any case, the reading from Exodus; about the escape through the Red Sea (reading 3) should never be omitted.; 10 Although not given the title of Solemnity, “[t]he first eight days of Easter Time constitute the Octave of Easter and are; celebrated as Solemnities of the Lord” (Universal Norms on the Liturgical Year and the Calendar, no. 24).
